intro: Perityle emoryi var. nuda, commonly known as the naked perityle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its simple, leafy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypsela. This variety is distinguished by its reduced or absent leaf stipules, giving it its common name.
